alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 1:09PM PST until January 07 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Elevations above 5500 feet in Western Siskiyou County. This includes Etna Summit on Sawyers Bar Rd. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult with longer travel times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will approach 1 inch an hour at times Friday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See tripcheck.com latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
